title: Red Hawk Pantry
description:
Visiting the Pantry: 
 1) Please have your Event Pass, CWID and have a  PantrySoft Registration .  2) Please bring your own shopping bag and ID card! ***Visitors are allowed to come once/week*** 
 Our Mission:   We aim to address food insecurity across Montclair State University. The Red Hawk Pantry is open to all students, staff, and faculty at no cost. If you are unable to visit during our regular hours, please reach out via email at redhawkpantry@montclair.edu Stay updated by following us on Instagram: @montclair_redhawkpantry 
   
 🍎 Fall 2025 Hours 
 
 Mondays: 1:30-3:30pm 
 Tuesdays: 5-7pm 
 Saturdays: 11-1pm

title: Library 101: Graduate Edition
description:
Welcome to Montclair University Libraries! Whether you’re straight out of undergrad and are looking for a basic refresher, or if it’s been several years and you need a complete re-introduction, come to this workshop for an overview of library resources available to you as a graduate student at Montclair State University. 
 In this workshop, we will cover: 
 
 Library collections and services 
 Research consultations 
 Interlibrary services 
 and more! 
 
 
 Related LibGuide:  Graduate Students Library Guide by Catherine Baird 
 Register Here:  https://montclair.libcal.com/event/16143370

title: Bohn Hall Community Meeting
description:
Join us for the Bohn Hall Community Meeting! This is your opportunity to connect with your Professional Staff, student staff, and fellow residents as we kick off the semester together. At this meeting, we’ll cover important information about living in Bohn Hall, including community expectations, resources, and ways to get involved. 
 Residents will also have the chance to ask questions, share feedback, and meet others in the building. Attendance is encouraged to stay up-to-date and make the most out of your living experience on campus. 
 What to Expect: 
 
 Resources and support available to you 
 Opportunities to connect with staff and peers 
 A chance to ask questions and share your voice 
 
 We look forward to seeing you there! 
 This event is for Bohn Hall Residents

title: Freeman and Russ January Floor Meeting
description:

title: CALI SCHOOL OF MUSIC: Cali Pathways Project Alumni Recital
description:
The Cali Pathways Project celebrates five years of supporting young musicians from under-resourced backgrounds with special performances by program alumni. 
 --- 
 Cali Pathways identifies talented and motivated students in grades 8-12, and assists them in bridging gaps that may otherwise preclude them from achieving their full musical potential. An individualized support plan is developed collaboratively and adjusted yearly for each student. 
 More info: https://www.montclair.edu/john-j-cali-school-of-music/pathways/

title: CALI SCHOOL OF MUSIC: Tuba & Euphonium College Audition Prep Masterclass
description:
This special event is designed for  high school tuba and euphonium students  preparing for college auditions. Selected performers will present 20-minute audition performances and receive individualized feedback, expert audition guidance, and strategies for continued improvement. All attendees are welcome to observe, take notes, and participate in a brief Q&A following the performances. 
 Tuba & Euphonium Masterclass Saturday, January 17, 2026 Noon–3:00 PM Leshowitz Recital Hall, Chapin Hall John J. Cali School of Music Montclair State University 
 Faculty: • Keith Kile, Tuba • Christopher Leslie, Euphonium 
 Free to attend  (registration required) Space is limited—early registration is encouraged. 
 More information & registration: https://bit.ly/ TubaEuphoniumMasterclass2026 
 Faculty bios: https://bit.ly/msu-brass- professors 
 We hope you’ll join us for this valuable opportunity to prepare for college auditions and connect with our brass faculty.

title: CALI SCHOOL OF MUSIC: Clarinet Day with Ricardo Morales
description:
Cali School of Music’s Clarinet Day 2026!   
 Montclair State University’s John J. Cali School of Music  invites you and your clarinet students to our Eighth Annual Clarinet Day to be held Sunday, January 18, 2026, starting 9:30 AM in Chapin Hall (home of the Cali School of Music) on the Montclair State University campus.   
 This inspirational all-day event will feature distinguished Cali School of Music clarinet faculty members  Benjamin Baron, Keriann DiBari  and  David Sapadin  along with our very special guest artist  Ricardo Morales,  principal clarinetist of the  Philadelphia Orchestra.   
 There will be a masterclass and performance by Ricardo Morales, insightful and motivational presentations by Cali School clarinet faculty, a clarinet choir for all participants to join, as well as vendors and repair services.   
 A light lunch will also be provided.  We invite you and your clarinet students to join us on this special day and celebrate all things clarinet!   
 This event is Free.  Registration is Required.  
 REGISTER HERE 
 Registration + Admin Questions: Dr. Marla Meissner, Recruitment + Student Visit Coordinator, Cali School of Music Email:  meissnerm@montclair.edu

title: MLK Day of Service - Blanket Making
description:
Honor Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s legacy by turning compassion into action at our MLK Day of Service Blanket Making event on Monday, January 19th from 10:00 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. in the SRC Racquetball Court. Join us for a cozy and impactful morning of service as we create blankets, no experience required, just a heart for giving back. This event is free for students with an MSU ID, and all blankets made will be donated to Eva’s Village to help keep community members warm this winter. Come make a difference—one blanket at a time! 
   
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 No registration required 
 FREE for students with a valid Montclair State ID 
 
 Where and when?

 10 am-12:30 pm 
 Student Recreation Center Racquetball Court

title: MLK Day of Service 2026 - REGISTER ON EVENTZILLA
description:
Join us for MLK Day of Service 2026 for a day on, not a day off!

 All are welcome to register! Students, alumni, faculty, family, friends, and more.

title: OPT Workshop - International Students (F-1 Visa Holders) Only
description: Learn more about pre-completion and post-completion Optional Practical Training (OPT) for F-1 students. Any student planning to apply for OPT is REQUIRED to attend a workshop before they can apply. This workshop is for CURRENT students ONLY - any other attendees will be removed.

title: Counseling (MA) Virtual Information Session
description:
Help others heal and build a career that matters The world needs more counselors who lead with empathy, insight, and purpose - and if you're ready to take that next step, we're here to help you get there.  We're hosting a virtual information session for our  Counseling  program: 
 
 Counseling (MA) Virtual Information Session January 20 at 4:00 PM (EST)  
 
 What you'll gain from the session: 
 
 Direct point of contact with faculty leading the program 
 Career outlook and insight from industry experts in the field 
 In-depth preview of your future coursework and what makes our curriculum stand out 
 Advanced understanding of the intricacies of the current counseling landscape

title: Journey of a Doctoral Candidate
description: This session provides an overview of the doctoral timeline at Montclair State University, from coursework and examinations to proposal development, dissertation research, and graduation. Students will learn about key milestones, required forms, and academic expectations at each stage, as well as how The Graduate School supports doctoral progress throughout the program. Who should attend:  New and early-stage doctoral students. Please register for the event through  this link .

title: Audiology (AuD) Virtual Information Session
description:
Take your research to the next level Our  Audiology program  is designed to empower you to excel in multiple roles—clinician, educator, administrator, and researcher. 
 
 As a clinician, you'll be able to identify the hearing health needs of individuals and design, implement and evaluate treatment plans to meet those needs.  
 In education, you'll be equipped to share your knowledge and inspire others in community healthcare settings. 
 As an administrator, you'll learn to lead, innovate, and elevate audiology services across diverse environments. 
 And with a strong foundation in research, you'll be ready to explore new frontiers in audiology, applying cutting-edge insights directly to your practice. 
 
 Join us for a virtual information session January 20 at 7:00 PM (EST)  to become a versatile leader in the dynamic field of audiology, where your impact can resonate for a lifetime.

title: New Year, New You - Vision Boards & Schedule Building - Join RA Jill
description:
Students will have the opportunity to learn about organization and time management through building schedules or calendars for their upcoming semester. Students will be able to express their creativity in creating these items. There will be a short slides presentation for students to learn how to build a calendar and utilize it throughout the year. The intent is to allow students to set goals and promote organization for the year to come. In all, students should gain a better understanding of themselves and time management through this program. 
 Location: Bloomfield Campus - Franklin Hall - Third Floor Multipurpose Room (MPR) - Room 314

title: Library 101
description:
This workshop is your introduction to all the ways Montclair State University Libraries support your academic success. It covers what resources are available to you (e.g., books, articles, films, databases) and how you can access them, including through interlibrary loan. You'll learn how to navigate the library website, distinguish between popular and scholarly sources, and get help from a librarian when working on a research assignment. 
 Related LibGuide: Library 101 by Bill Vincenti 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/16138220

title: Tri-Alpha Tabling
description:
Come join Tri-Alpha Honor Society for a tabling event! Here, you will learn all about Tri-Alpha and what you can do to join! 
 About Tri-Alpha: 
 Tri-Alpha, founded in 2018 at Moravian University, recognizes and supports first-generation college students through academic achievement, leadership, and networking. The Delta Chi Chapter at Montclair State, established in 2021, welcomes students, faculty, staff, and alumni whose parents did not earn a bachelor’s degree. Membership offers lifelong benefits, including a certificate and pin, recognition of academic excellence, networking opportunities with other first-gen scholars, mentoring, and leadership roles, while signaling to employers and graduate schools a commitment to high achievement.

title: Mathematics Education PhD Virtual Information Session
description:
Shape Classrooms, Curriculum, & Careers 
 Tune into our  Mathematics Education PhD Webinar January 21 at 5:00 PM (EST).   Meet our faculty and discover how this program can bring you closer to your goals. View the program flyer  for more information about coursework, career outcomes, and what makes Montclair different.  Looking for funding opportunities?  Montclair offers several  funding opportunities  for Ph.D. students in Mathematics Education, including grant-funded fellowships, university-funded assistantships, hourly research roles for part-time students, and adjunct teaching positions for advanced candidates.

title: Graduate Mathematics Programs Virtual Information Session
description:
Enhance your Mathematics knowledge with Montclair's graduate programs! 
 The Department of Mathematics at Montclair State University offers multiple graduate programs in Mathematics: 
   
 
 Mathematics Education (MA) Online - Fully Online (synchronous) - 11 Courses to complete - Intended for future and current teachers interested in enhancing their understanding of K12 mathematics and related teaching practices. 
 
   
 
 Teaching Middle Grades Mathematics Certificate Online Program - Fully Online (synchronous) - 5 Courses (counts toward MA above) - Designed for current or future middle grades mathematics teachers, including current teachers in related disciplines (e.g., science, business, computer science) as well as in other disciplines, who are teaching, preparing to teach, or are interested in teaching mathematics in the middle grades. 
 
   
 
 MS in Mathematics, Mathematics Education Concentration - In-Person and Online Courses - 11-12 Courses to complete  - Intended for students who are currently teachers interested in enhancing their content knowledge, exploring current research-based pedagogies, or considering doctoral studies in mathematics education (we also offer a  Mathematics Education PhD program !)    
 Elementary School Certification with Subject Matter Specialization: Mathematics in Grades 5-8 Online Program -  Online courses - 5 courses  - Additional teacher certification program for candidates who already hold an appropriate New Jersey CEAS or Standard Certification in another content area. This additional certification entitles the candidate to teach mathematics in Grades 5-8 in all New Jersey public schools. 
 
 Registration is LIVE for our Graduate Mathematics Programs Virtual Information Session January 24 at 11:00 AM (EST) . If you're interested in understanding math on a deeper level, wish to learn new teaching strategies for your students, and grow as a professional, our information session is the perfect place to connect directly with the faculty in the department.

description:

 Never swam before? No problem! These lessons will give you the important foundational skills in swimming and help you be more comfortable in the pool. Learn how to use proper breath control, float, and swim with a kickboard.

Students are encouraged to  bring a guest  who may also be interested in exploring science teaching.

Whether you are just beginning to explore the idea of teaching or already on the path toward certification, these meetings are a place to grow, learn, and belong.

description: Designed for Where You Want to Go Next Montclair’s  MBA programs  are built for professionals who are ready to lead with purpose—and back it up with strategy. Whether you’re climbing higher in your current role or ready to pivot into something new, our flexible, career-focused curriculum will help you build the skills, confidence, and connections to make it happen.  Registration is open for our  virtual information session January 29 at 12:00 PM (EST) . Join us to explore our MBA pathways and find the one that aligns with your goals.

title: Higher Education (MA) Virtual Information Session
description:
Build your career in Higher Education    
 Whether you're already working in  higher ed  or looking to break into the field, our flexible program is designed to meet you where you are - and help you go even further. 
 We're hosting a  virtual information session on January 29  at 6:00 PM . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. 
 Our coursework offers a broad focus on administration and leadership, preparing students for a variety of roles in higher education. The curriculum integrates organizational and social science perspectives and explores key administrative and programmatic issues.

title: CALI SCHOOL OF MUSIC: Montclair State Mainstage Opera "DIE ZAUBERFLÖTE"
description:
Montclair State  Mainstage Opera & University  Symphony Orchestra  
   
 presents 
 DIE ZAUBERFLÖTE 
 Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart,  Composer 
 Emanuel Schikaneder,  Librettist 
 Janine Morita Colletti, Director Kyle Ritenauer, Conductor 
 Valentina Cannao,  Scenic & Costume Design 
 David Orlando,   Lighting Design 
 Lili Federico,  Multimedia/Projection Design 
 Maxine Steinman,  Choreographer 
 Paige Elise Buchanan Stewart,  Livestream Production 
   
 Alexander Kasser Theater 
 Saturday, January 31 @ 8:00 PM  Tickets Sunday, February 1 @ 3:00 PM  Tickets   
   
 
 
 A dragon to be vanquished. A magic flute that conquers hearts. A queen whose rage blazes among the stars. A secretive order holding the power of the sun. 
 
 
 One of the most beloved operas of all time, Mozart’s  Die Zauberflöte  ( The Magic Flute ) is a dazzling adventure where fairy tale, comedy, and timeless wisdom meet.  With music that soars from the hilarious to the sublime, it enchants audiences of all ages. 
 Follow Prince Tamino and Princess Pamina as they brave trials of fire, water, and silence in their search for love and enlightenment. Laugh with the irrepressible bird-catcher Papageno, and be swept away by the Queen of the Night’s blazing vengeance and show-stopping arias. Beneath its fantastical surface lies a story of courage, compassion, and the triumph of harmony over darkness. 
 Join us for an unforgettable journey of magic, music, and imagination. 
 Sung in German • Spoken dialogue in English (Janine Morita Colletti)

title: Skills for Success: The Truth About Soft Skills
description:
Think success in college and beyond is all about technical know-how? Think again! This interactive workshop uncovers the real power of soft skills—like communication, teamwork, problem-solving, conflict resolution, and adaptability—that employers and professors alike value most. Through hands-on activities and real-world examples, you’ll learn how to recognize, strengthen, and showcase these essential skills to thrive as a student and future professional. 
 Event Details: 📅 Date: Tuesday, February 3, 2026 🕒 Time: 2 - 3 pm 📍 Location: Susan A. Cole Hall, Suite 340 (3rd Floor) 
 Presented by the University College Academic Programming Team. This event is open to all University College (pre-major) students. 
 There will be complimentary food.

title: Educational Leadership (MA) – Fast Track Virtual Information Session
description:
Accelerate your path to leadership 
 Our  Fast Track option  for the Educational Leadership (MA) allows students to earn a 36-credit degree and principal and supervisor certification in 14 months while working full-time. This program is completed within a one-year time frame, from summer to summer. 
 New cohorts for the Fast Track Option begin each Summer. Interested applicants should  complete their application for admission by April 1   each year. Join us for a webinar on February 7 at 10:00 AM (EST)   to learn how this fast-track option can propel aspiring leaders and administrators toward their goals.

title: Magnificent Bird / Book of Travelers | Two Song Cycles written and performed by Gabriel Kahane
description:
Experience two distinct works by acclaimed songwriter and performer Gabriel Kahane in one unforgettable day.  
   
 In this duo of intimate solo musical plays, composer Gabriel Kahane blends songwriting and storytelling for a singular, poignant theatrical event. Book of Travelers recounts the strangers he met on a 9,000-mile train journey through a divided America, and Magnificent Bird chronicles a year he spent entirely off-line, and the unexpected turbulence of living quietly. Performed on alternating nights, these two concept albums offer a relentless self-inquiry, and a searing portrait of a world in flux.  To join us, be sure to pick up your free student ticket from the Alexander Kasser Theatre box office or our mobile box office in the student center lobby, Tuesday - Thursday, 11:30 AM to 2:00 PM, and show your student ID at the PEAK desk in the lobby when you arrive for a surprise gift from PEAK. 
   
 Hailed as “one of the finest songwriters of the day” by The New Yorker, Gabriel Kahane is a musician and storyteller whose work spans the theater, club, and concert hall. Highlights of the 2024-25 season include a return to the New York stage in a production at Playwrights Horizons, performances at the Philharmonie de Paris, Wigmore Hall, and the Concertgebouw with fellow composer/performer Caroline Shaw, the premiere of a clarinet concerto for Anthony McGill, a solo debut with the Orchestre National de Lyon, and Kahane’s San Francisco conducting debut in Carla Kihlstedt’s Twenty-six Little Deaths. Kahane's collaborators range from Phoebe Bridgers, Paul Simon, Sufjan Stevens, and Sylvan Esso, to the Danish String Quartet, Roomful of Teeth, and Attacca Quartet. As a writer, he has been published by The New Yorker online and The New York Times; a newsletter and collection of essays on music, literature, and politics can be found at  gabrielkahane.substack.com . 
   
 4:00 pm Magnificent Bird 
 Run Time:  74 minutes, no intermission. 
   
 Magnificent Bird, is an intimate reflection on a year of self-imposed isolation during which the artist set out to write a song every day. With contributions from Andrew Bird, Chris Thile, Amelia Meath (Sylvan Esso), and Pulitzer Prize- winning composer Caroline Shaw, this collection explores the delicate balance between personal introspection and global crises. It’s a vivid musical snapshot of life during a tumultuous period, offering both a personal and universal meditation on modern-day existence. Based on Kahane’s fifth LP. 
   
 7:00 pm - Book of Travelers 
 Run Time:  70 minutes, no intermission 
   
 In Book of Travelers, Gabriel Kahane embarks on a journey across the United States, exploring the intersections of American identity and personal connection through the people he meets along the way. This powerful and emotional piece blends folk, classical, and pop influences to create a nuanced reflection on contemporary life in America. The work is a poignant and intimate exploration of what it means to traverse a country at a crossroads.

title: CSAM Science Teaching Program - Program Meeting
description:
The  CSAM Science Teaching Program  holds  biweekly meetings  that are open, welcoming, and inclusive! Any student curious about science teaching is invited to join us. Each meeting highlights a theme related to science education, from classroom strategies to career pathways, and offers students opportunities to connect with mentors, explore internships, and gain real-world experience working with teachers and children. Students are encouraged to  bring a guest  who may also be interested in exploring science teaching. 
 These gatherings help us build a strong  community of support , where students encourage one another, share experiences, and access valuable opportunities such as  scholarships, paid internships, and mentoring  from advanced peers and in-service science teachers. Whether you are just beginning to explore the idea of teaching or already on the path toward certification, these meetings are a place to grow, learn, and belong.

title: CALI SCHOOL OF MUSIC: Immersive Residency Program Cali Midweek Series with PAQUITO D’RIVERA
description:
Cali Immersive Residency Program Cali Midweek Series: Cali Conversation and Performance with PAQUITO D'RIVERA and Cali School of Music Jazz Studies Area Coordinator Dr. Oscar Perez Leshowitz Recital Hall, Chapin Hall, Cali School of Music FREE – Reservations Suggested 
 CUBAN-AMERICAN SAXOPHONIST AND CLARINETIST Cali Immersive Residency Program On Campus: FEBRUARY 9–13, 2026 
 Full Immersive Residency Schedule 
 Paquito D’Rivera  is a celebrated Cuban-born clarinetist, saxophonist, and composer whose genre-defying career spans Latin jazz, classical music, and beyond. Winner of 16 Grammy and Latin Grammy Awards, he was a founding member of Irakere and Dizzy Gillespie’s United Nation Orchestra, and has recorded over 40 solo albums. A child prodigy and son of classical saxophonist Tito Rivera, he has performed with major orchestras worldwide and composed for top ensembles including Yo-Yo Ma and Imani Winds. Also a writer and producer, D’Rivera is known for his eclectic style and for championing Latin musical traditions on the global stage.

title: I AM | Camille A. Brown & Dancers
description:
Five-time Tony nominated choreographer and director Camille A. Brown deepens her explorations of Black joy in Camille A. Brown & Dancers’  I AM . With captivating live and original music,  I AM  launches new queries into the possibilities of imagination—and boldly investigates the future. Inspired by a narrative within HBO’s  Lovecraft Country  and the rhythms of the movie  Drumline , Brown’s 2025 New York Times Critics’ Pick breaks boundaries and “takes her signature interweaving of African diasporic dance forms to new heights.” —  The New York Times 
   
  To join us, be sure to pick up your free student ticket from the Alexander Kasser Theatre box office or our mobile box office in the student center lobby, Tuesdays and Thursdays, 11:30 AM to 2:00 PM, and show your student ID at the PEAK desk in the lobby when you arrive for a surprise gift from PEAK.

title: 2026 Black Alumni Advisory Council Black History Month Career Panel
location: University Hall 1050 - Ingrid & Scott Williams Lecture Hall
description:
Heirs and Architects of a Great Legacy: Black History Month Alumni Event 
 In partnership with the African American Caucus and the African American Studies Department at Montclair State University, this special Black History Month event celebrates our history while providing tools to elevate your career. Join us for a unique opportunity to connect and network with accomplished alumni across diverse industries, united by the strength of family and community legacy. Hear from a panel of professionals who will share valuable insights to guide your career journey. Let their stories inspire and empower you to take your next step forward. 
 Event Details 🗓  Date:  Monday, February 16 ⏰  Time:  4 – 6:30 p.m. 📍  Location:  University Hall 1050 - Ingrid & Scott Williams Lecture Hall 💰  Cost:  FREE 📝  Registration:  Required (Sign up now!) 
   
 What’s in it for you? 
 
 Career Panel featuring alumni in the social services, business and the sciences 
 Networking with professionals who’ve been where you are, and who are now empowering others with their knowledge 
 Tips for launching your career and navigating your next steps 
 Direct access to alumni who are crushing it in their fields, showing the power of roots and wings in action 
 
   
 Meet the Panelists - TBD 
   
   
   
 What is BAAC? The Black Alumni Advisory Council (BAAC) connects Montclair State University alumni to current students to share knowledge, offer mentorship, and amplify social justice and inclusion in the community. We honor the strength of our shared roots while supporting the rise of empowered futures. 
 . 
 
   
 What is the African American Caucus of Montclair State University? 
 Awareness, Advocacy, and Change  The African American Caucus (AAC) of Montclair State University serves as a forum for discussion and advocacy regarding matters and issues important to faculty, staff, and students of African descent at Montclair State University. 
   
 What is African American Studies? 
 The African American Studies Minor is an interdisciplinary program.  Students examine the contributions people of African descent have made to human and world history. Courses critically analyze a wide range of philosophies, cultural experiences, social issues, leadership models and solutions to social problems. The program builds on the African American Studies scholar-activist tradition. Students explore education as a means not only for creating personal success but for developing stronger societies rooted in respect for diversity and human rights. 
   
 Got questions? Contact  The Office of Alumni Engagement at alumni@montclair.edu or 973-655-4141 
 This is your chance to level up your career game – don’t miss it!

title: 2026 Legislative Breakfast: Human Trafficking at the Intersection of Sports
description:
Join us for the 4th Annual Legislative Breakfast  as Montclair State University convenes leaders, advocates, and the campus community to confront human trafficking in New Jersey and explore pathways for real change. 
 Now in its fourth year, the Legislative Breakfast brings together policymakers, survivor leaders, academics, students, and community partners for timely, solutions-oriented conversations at the intersection of research, policy, and practice. This is a unique opportunity for the MSU community to engage directly with issues shaping law, advocacy, and prevention efforts across the state. 
 This year’s theme,  “Human Trafficking at the Intersection of Sports,”  examines the often-overlooked risks connected to major sporting events. From labor exploitation in construction, hospitality, and event operations to increased vulnerabilities during large-scale tournaments, the conversation moves beyond headlines to focus on evidence-based policy responses and accountability. 
 Last year’s sold-out breakfast featured nationally recognized experts, survivor leaders, and New Jersey legislators—and this year’s program promises equally compelling dialogue and actionable insights. Students and staff alike are encouraged to attend, learn, and be part of a growing campus-wide commitment to prevention, awareness, and informed action. For any questions, please reach out to gcht@montclair.edu 
 
 
 
 
 -------------------------------------- Agenda 
 8:00 AM - 9:00 AM |  Registration Opens 
 9:15 AM - 9:45 AM |  Opening Remarks 
 9:45 AM - 10:15 AM |  4th Annual Smith/Wellstone Award Ceremony 
 10:15 AM - 10:30 AM |  Networking Break 
 10:30 AM - 11:45 AM |  Human Trafficking at the Intersection of Sports 
 11:45 AM - 12:30 PM |  Closing Remarks and Networking If you plan to attend the full event and would like a name badge,  please register on Eventbrite. This event is free and open to all.  ---- 
 This event is brought you by the Global Center on Human Trafficking at Montclair State University, along with its co-sponsors: - Montclair State University 
 
 College of Humanities and Social Sciences 
 Department of Justice Studies 
 Department of Social Work and Child Advocacy 
 Office of Government Relations 
 Department of Athletics 
 Department of Recreation 
 
 - It's a Penalty - Mission89 - Covenant House NJ - Family Service League - LSNJ - New Jersey Coalition Against Human Trafficking

description:

Here's what we've got lined up on Sunday, February 22:

 Learn about pathways for career changers, working professionals, and international students 
 
 Did you know?  If you attend a session, you can apply to Montclair for free. The $60 application fee will be waived as our thank you for spending time with us. This could be your moment to discover which programs feel like a natural fit. We hope you can tune in!

title: Rent In Concert | Musical in Concert | Produced by AMP Worldwide
description:
Experience the iconic music of  RENT  like never before. In this sweeping symphonic concert produced by AMP Worldwide, a powerhouse ensemble of vocalists and instrumentalists brings Jonathan Larson’s groundbreaking rock musical to life in a sweeping symphonic concert. Featuring the full score—including “Seasons of Love,” “La Vie Bohème,” and “Take Me or Leave Me”—this electrifying performance celebrates the enduring spirit of love, loss, and chosen family. 
   
 Set in New York City’s East Village at the height of the HIV/AIDS crisis,  RENT  follows a group of young artists as they chase their dreams, navigate heartbreak, and fight to live—and love—fully in the moment. Winner of the Tony Award for Best Musical and the Pulitzer Prize for Drama,  RENT  remains a cultural touchstone with music that resonates across generations. 
   
 To join us, be sure to pick up your free student ticket from the Alexander Kasser Theatre box office or our mobile box office in the student center lobby, Tuesdays and Thursdays, 11:30 AM to 2:00 PM, and show your student ID at the PEAK desk in the lobby when you arrive for a surprise gift from PEAK.

title: Free Swim Lessons *Beginner*
description:
Never swam before? No problem! These lessons will give you the important foundational skills in swimming and help you be more comfortable in the pool. Learn how to use proper breath control, float, and swim with a kickboard.  
 Skills Focus: 
 
 Being comfortable in the water 
 Learning how to float on your back and front 
 Learning how to kick off the wall with a kickboard 
 Introducing proper breath control in the water 
 Learning how to tread water 
 Learn alternate kicks (Froggy Kick) 
 Being comfortable in the deep end  
 Introducing arms to your strokes 
 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE with a valid Montclair State ID 
 
 When and Where? 
 
 Tuesday: 5-6PM 
 Student Recreation Center - Pool

title: Free Swim Lessons *Intermediate*
description:

title: Community and Social Services Career Expo
organization: College of Humanities and Social Sciences (CHSS)
description:
Community and Social Services Career Expo Date:  February 24, 2026 Time:  3:30pm-6:30pm Location:  University Hall Conference Center (7th Floor) 
 Pre-registration is strongly encouraged -  Register on Handshake ! 
 Calling all community and service-minded students exploring clinical and non-clinical career options! 
 Are you looking for a job or internship? Are you curious about the career paths you can pursue with your major or graduate program? If so, the Community and Social Services Career Expo is an amazing opportunity to meet employers that align with your professional interests. Whether you are a freshman or a graduate student, this event is designed to help you explore career possibilities, gain networking experience by talking with employers, and make connections that may eventually lead to a job or internship. There will be fun mixed in with the opportunity to win raffle prizes, and Rocky, Roxy, or Pebbles might even stop by! 
 More Information: - Visit with non-profit, government, and corporate employers that have a service-oriented mission - Discover opportunities with campus organizations and departments, including international experiences that incorporate social impact - Event details and employer list can be found on  Handshake . - Dress neatly and bring resumes! Check out Rocky's Closet for free professional attire. 
 This event is ideal for graduate and undergraduate students seeking jobs and internships in: Counseling, Child Advocacy, Justice Studies, Social Work, Political Science, Psychology and so much more! 
   
 Co-sponsored by:  College of Humanities and Social Sciences, College for Community Health, Office of Community Engagement and Partnerships, Office of Experiential Education and Career Connections, Office of Government Relations, Office of International Academic Initiatives 
   
 Questions? Contact Jennifer Dudeck-Lenis at  dudecklenisj@montclair.edu.

title: Podcasting 101: Launch Your Voice
description: Ready to share your voice with the world? This workshop covers the essentials of creating, recording, and publishing your own podcast—from planning your content to using tech tools for editing and distribution. Learn how to craft compelling stories and build an audience through the power of sound. RSVP: https://www.tickettailor.com/events/adpcenterforlearningtechnologies

title: CSAM Science Teaching Program - Program Meeting
description:
The  CSAM Science Teaching Program  holds  biweekly meetings  that are open, welcoming, and inclusive! Any student curious about science teaching is invited to join us. Each meeting highlights a theme related to science education, from classroom strategies to career pathways, and offers students opportunities to connect with mentors, explore internships, and gain real-world experience working with teachers and children. Students are encouraged to  bring a guest  who may also be interested in exploring science teaching. 
 These gatherings help us build a strong  community of support , where students encourage one another, share experiences, and access valuable opportunities such as  scholarships, paid internships, and mentoring  from advanced peers and in-service science teachers. Whether you are just beginning to explore the idea of teaching or already on the path toward certification, these meetings are a place to grow, learn, and belong.

title: Spring 2026 Business Job & Internship Fair
organization: The Office for Experiential Education and Career Connections
description:
Please join us for the upcoming Spring 2026 Business Job & Internship Fair. You will have the opportunity to network with employers recruiting for available full-time and internship opportunities. Registration is required. Students must bring their Montclair State University Student IDs the day of the event. Please dress in professional attire. 
   
 Feb 25, 1:00 pm - 4:00 pm 
 University Hall Conference Center, 7th Floor, 1 Normal Ave, Montclair, NJ 07043 
 Register in Handshake  
 Sponsored by the Feliciano School of Business Career Services

title: Safe Space Training
description:
Our Safe Space Training is an intensive, interactive training that provides attendees with information and tools to combat homophobia, biphobia, transphobia, cissexism and heterosexism, on campus and beyond. Through interactive activities and discussion, participants will personally reflect on their own experiences to enhance their personal and professional development, provide further education, and finally, identify ways to create change on campus and beyond. 
 All sessions are three hours and are first-come, first-served. Pre-registration is required. Registrants are expected to attend the full session. Only individuals who have fully completed the Safe Space Program and have agreed to the expectations of its membership are able to display the sticker/button of our program. Refreshments are not provided; however, you are more than welcome to bring your lunch, coffee, snacks, etc.

description:
Join us for the Bohn Hall Community Meeting! This is your opportunity to connect with your Professional Staff, student staff, and fellow residents as we kick off the semester together. At this meeting, we’ll cover important information about living in Bohn Hall, including community expectations, resources, and ways to get involved. 
 Residents will also have the chance to ask questions, share feedback, and meet others in the building. Attendance is encouraged to stay up-to-date and make the most out of your living experience on campus. 
 What to Expect: 
 
 Resources and support available to you 
 Opportunities to connect with staff and peers 
 A chance to ask questions and share your voice 
 
 We look forward to seeing you there! 
 This event is for Bohn Hall Residents

title: Canva Masterclass: Advanced Pro Tools & Design Hacks
description: Ready to level up your Canva skills? This advanced workshop dives into powerful features like animations, brand kits, collaboration tools, and interactive content creation. Go beyond the basics and learn how to streamline your design process with features like Canva’s Whiteboard for brainstorming, Website Builder for creating interactive web pages, and Presentation Mode with embedded video and transitions. Whether you're building classroom resources, school branding materials, or engaging digital content. Participants will also explore team templates, content scheduling, and how to manage brand consistency across multiple projects. RSVP: https://www.tickettailor.com/events/adpcenterforlearningtechnologies

title: Career Ready with AI
description: Prepare for the modern job market by learning how to use technology and artificial intelligence to your advantage. This workshop explores AI-driven tools for job searching, networking, interview preparation, and resume development. Participants will learn how to use platforms like Canva, Google, and AI editors to design, edit, and tailor resumes while strategically presenting their skills and experiences. Discover how AI can help you tell your professional story with clarity, creativity, and confidence— so you can stand out in a rapidly evolving career landscape. RSVP: https://www.tickettailor.com/events/adpcenterforlearningtechnologies

title: Clinical Psychology (MA) Virtual Information Session
description:
Transform Lives With A Career In Clinical Psychology 
 Montclair's Clinical Psychology program combines advanced education with practical experience. Whether you’re interested in working in private practice or research, we’ll walk you through the wide range of career paths available for clinical psychology graduates. We offer two  STEM-Designated  concentrations within our rigorous Master's program, tailored to your unique practice objectives: 
 
 Clinical Psychology, Child/Adolescent Psychology Concentration (MA) Students in the child/adolescent concentration learn about the unique psychological needs of children and adolescents, as well as developmental considerations in psychopathology, assessment, and treatment, including the role of family and social contexts. This concentration is designed to prepare students for MA-level clinical positions in mental health settings, particularly those that serve children and families.    
 Clinical Psychology, Forensic Psychology Concentration (MA) The Forensic Psychology concentration is designed to prepare students to offer master’s level clinical services to legal system-involved populations in settings that do not require licensure. Such settings include mental health and drug court settings, offender rehabilitation programs, child and family advocacy settings and bona fide public service agencies exempted by state boards of psychological examiners for non-doctoral providers. 
 
 Ready to learn more? Join us for a  virtual information session on March 9 at 5:30 PM (EST)  to explore Montclair's programs in Clinical Psychology and speak directly with our faculty.

title: Safe Space Training
description:
Our Safe Space Training is an intensive, interactive training that provides attendees with information and tools to combat homophobia, biphobia, transphobia, cissexism and heterosexism, on campus and beyond. Through interactive activities and discussion, participants will personally reflect on their own experiences to enhance their personal and professional development, provide further education, and finally, identify ways to create change on campus and beyond. 
 All sessions are three hours and are first-come, first-served. Pre-registration is required. Registrants are expected to attend the full session. Only individuals who have fully completed the Safe Space Program and have agreed to the expectations of its membership are able to display the sticker/button of our program. Refreshments are not provided; however, you are more than welcome to bring your lunch, coffee, snacks, etc.

title: Higher Education (MA) Virtual Information Session
description:
Build your career in Higher Education    
 Whether you're already working in  higher ed  or looking to break into the field, our flexible program is designed to meet you where you are - and help you go even further. 
 We're hosting a  virtual information session on March 19  at 6:00 PM . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. 
 Our coursework offers a broad focus on administration and leadership, preparing students for a variety of roles in higher education. The curriculum integrates organizational and social science perspectives and explores key administrative and programmatic issues.

title: Child Advocacy (MA) Alumni Perspectives: Advocating for Children in 2026
description:
Lead Change in Child Advocacy and Policy   When children and families face complex challenges, they need informed, compassionate professionals to stand up, speak out, and shape solutions. If you're ready to turn your commitment into action, we're here to help.  We're hosting a  virtual panel featuring alumni from our program on March 19 at 6:00 PM (EST) . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to hear directly from professionals who were once in your shoes and determine if our program fits your goals. This session will cover the following programs:  
 
 Online Master of Arts in Child Advocacy and Policy 
 Child Advocacy (Certificate) – Online 
 
 Why Montclair?  Completing the certificate program allows you to transfer all 15 credits towards the Master of Arts in Child Advocacy, in accordance with all related graduate policy.

title: CSAM Science Teaching Program - Program Meeting
description:
The  CSAM Science Teaching Program  holds  biweekly meetings  that are open, welcoming, and inclusive! Any student curious about science teaching is invited to join us. Each meeting highlights a theme related to science education, from classroom strategies to career pathways, and offers students opportunities to connect with mentors, explore internships, and gain real-world experience working with teachers and children. Students are encouraged to  bring a guest  who may also be interested in exploring science teaching. 
 These gatherings help us build a strong  community of support , where students encourage one another, share experiences, and access valuable opportunities such as  scholarships, paid internships, and mentoring  from advanced peers and in-service science teachers. Whether you are just beginning to explore the idea of teaching or already on the path toward certification, these meetings are a place to grow, learn, and belong.

title: Bench Press and Squat Competition
description:
Spring Strength Shadow! Welcome back to our annual Bench Press & Squat Competition. Come and test power and show your gains. Each event will feature 5 reps max. Whether you're chasing PRs or just want to flex for fun, this event is for you! Bring your friends and your lifting straps, and see who can lift their way to the top prize! 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE with a valid Montclair State ID 
 
 When and Where? 
 
 Data: March 30th 
 Time: 3pm - 6pm 
 Student Recreation Center, Plae Room 
 
 How are results scored 
 
 Maximum 5 repetitions  
 1 attempt per lift after a warm up set 
 Scoring calculation: Weight lifted x repetitions divided by body weight  
 Final score will be a total of both lifts combined  
 
 Prizes :  
 
 Will be given to the top 3 winners  
 Tier 1: Beat Headphone ,  Fitness Watch ,  Air Fryer  $100-$200 
 Tier 2:  Massage Gun ,  Meal Prep Kit ,  Pilates Kit  $50-$100 
 Tier 3:  Foam Roller Set ,  Liquid IV ,  Owala Water Bottle  $20-$50 
 
 Free T-shirts - limited supply so show up early to claim one!

title: VR in the Classroom
description: Step into the future of learning with virtual reality! This workshop explores how VR can transform lessons into immersive, interactive experiences that engage students like never before. Learn practical ways to integrate VR tools into your teaching to make learning more dynamic, memorable, and fun. RSVP: https://www.tickettailor.com/events/adpcenterforlearningtechnologies

title: Design Your Day: Discover Your Direction
description:
Not sure what to major in or where you're headed after college? Let’s change that—starting with the kind of  day  you want to have. In this hands-on, creative workshop, you’ll: 
 1) Visualize your ideal workday—where you are, who you’re with, and what you’re doing. 
 2) Identify your key work-life preferences, like flexibility, collaboration, or creativity. 
 3) Explore majors and careers that align with your vision through UC’s AI-powered  Major Mentor , a tool that matches your preferences to Montclair majors and career paths. 
 This event is open to all University College (pre-major) students. RSVP is required.  There will be complimentary food.

title: Pie a Beta
organization: Sigma Lambda Beta International Fraternity Inc.
description:
Join the brothers of Sigma Lambda Beta International Fraternity, Incorporated for our “Pie a Beta” fundraiser! Stop by and take part in the fun by getting the chance to pie a brother, whipped cream, laughs, and good vibes guaranteed. It’s a lighthearted way to support our chapter while bringing the campus community together. 
   
 Can’t make it in person? No worries! Online donations are welcome, and a willing brother will gladly take a pie on your behalf. Whether you’re throwing a pie or donating from afar, your support helps us continue our community initiatives and chapter programming. Come out, have fun, and help us reach our fundraising goal!

title: CSAM Science Teaching Program - Program Meeting
description:
The  CSAM Science Teaching Program  holds  biweekly meetings  that are open, welcoming, and inclusive! Any student curious about science teaching is invited to join us. Each meeting highlights a theme related to science education, from classroom strategies to career pathways, and offers students opportunities to connect with mentors, explore internships, and gain real-world experience working with teachers and children. title: Safe Space Training
description:
Our Safe Space Training is an intensive, interactive training that provides attendees with information and tools to combat homophobia, biphobia, transphobia, cissexism and heterosexism, on campus and beyond. Through interactive activities and discussion, participants will personally reflect on their own experiences to enhance their personal and professional development, provide further education, and finally, identify ways to create change on campus and beyond. 
 All sessions are three hours and are first-come, first-served. Pre-registration is required. Registrants are expected to attend the full session. Only individuals who have fully completed the Safe Space Program and have agreed to the expectations of its membership are able to display the sticker/button of our program. Refreshments are not provided; however, you are more than welcome to bring your lunch, coffee, snacks, etc.

title: AI Literacy for Educators
description: The AI literacy for educators designed to support educators in building a strong, practical understanding of artificial intelligence in educational contexts. This workshop will help educators understand foundational AI concepts, critically evaluate AI tools and outputs, recognize how bias and inequity can emerge in AI systems, and examine the ethical and societal implications of AI use in teaching and learning. Participants will also explore strategies for working with AI responsibly, emphasizing informed decision-making and human-centered AI practice. RSVP: https://www.tickettailor.com/events/adpcenterforlearningtechnologies

title: Denim Day 2026: Mind the Gaps, Move Forward
description:
April is Sexual Assault Awareness Month, and together, we can break the silence.  The Montclair State University Police Department and the Office of Advocacy & Outreach are committed to fostering a campus where survivors feel heard, supported, and empowered.  It starts with believing. It starts with you.  By offering a safe and affirming response to those who disclose gender-based and sexual violence, we can create lasting change. Let’s stand together to end the cycle of silence—because  every voice matters, and every action counts. 
 Denim Day is recognized internationally as a day of action and awareness, encouraging people to wear denim to challenge victim-blaming and educate others about sexual violence.  This year, Denim Day falls on Wednesday, April 29, 2026. 
 The University Police and  Office of Advocacy & Outreach and the Office of Advocacy and Community Resilience , in partnership with over 30 campus and local community organizations, invites you to join us  from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m. at the Amphitheater  for a powerful awareness event honoring survivors and increasing awareness of available resources. 
 Despite the  gaps  that still exist in the criminal justice system, in resources, and in prevention education,  we will move forward together  as a community. As part of this commitment, we will walk  one mile around campus in solidarity with survivors.

title: Canva Masterclass: Advanced Pro Tools & Design Hacks
description: Ready to level up your Canva skills? This advanced workshop dives into powerful features like animations, brand kits, collaboration tools, and interactive content creation. Go beyond the basics and learn how to streamline your design process with features like Canva’s Whiteboard for brainstorming, Website Builder for creating interactive web pages, and Presentation Mode with embedded video and transitions. Whether you're building classroom resources, school branding materials, or engaging digital content. Participants will also explore team templates, content scheduling, and how to manage brand consistency across multiple projects. RSVP: https://www.tickettailor.com/events/adpcenterforlearningtechnologies
